title: Combining Data Sets
text:
Problem One
Take a closer look at the three data frames - happy, happy_join_one, and happy_full

glimpse(happy)

Rows: 5
Columns: 4
$ country_name   <chr> "Iraq", "Comoros", "Panama", "Maldives", "Spain"
$ ladder_score   <dbl> 4.854, 4.289, 6.180, 5.198, 6.491
$ gdp            <dbl> 9.240, 8.031, 10.350, 9.826, 10.571
$ social_support <dbl> 0.746, 0.626, 0.896, 0.913, 0.932

glimpse(happy_join_one)

Rows: 5
Columns: 2
$ country_name            <chr> "Iraq", "Comoros", "Panama", "Maldives", "Spai…
$ healthy_life_expectancy <dbl> 60.583, 57.349, 69.652, 70.600, 74.700

glimpse(happy_full)

title: Combining Data Sets
text:
Problem Two
Combine happy and happy_join_one by row

bind_rows(happy, happy_join_one)

# A tibble: 10 × 5
   country_name ladder_score   gdp social_support healthy_life_expectancy
   <chr>               <dbl> <dbl>          <dbl>                   <dbl>
 1 Iraq                 4.85  9.24          0.746                    NA  
 2 Comoros              4.29  8.03          0.626                    NA  
 3 Panama               6.18 10.4           0.896                    NA  
 4 Maldives             5.20  9.83          0.913                    NA  
 5 Spain                6.49 10.6           0.932                    NA  
 6 Iraq                NA    NA            NA                        60.6
 7 Comoros             NA    NA            NA                        57.3
 8 Panama              NA    NA            NA                        69.7
 9 Maldives            NA    NA            NA                        70.6
10 Spain               NA    NA            NA                        74.7

title: Combining Data Sets
text:
Problem Three
Combine happy and happy_join_one by column

nrow(happy) == nrow(happy_join_one)

[1] TRUE

bind_cols(happy, happy_join_one)

New names:
• `country_name` -> `country_name...1`
• `country_name` -> `country_name...5`


# A tibble: 5 × 6
  country_name...1 ladder_score   gdp social_support country_name...5
  <chr>                   <dbl> <dbl>          <dbl> <chr>           
1 Iraq                     4.85  9.24          0.746 Iraq            
2 Comoros                  4.29  8.03          0.626 Comoros         
3 Panama                   6.18 10.4           0.896 Panama          
4 Maldives                 5.20  9.83          0.913 Maldives        
5 Spain                    6.49 10.6           0.932 Spain           
# ℹ 1 more variable: healthy_life_expectancy <dbl>

title: Combining Data Sets
text:
Problem Four
Which join function is a better alternative to the previous solution?

happy%>%
  inner_join(happy_join_one)

Joining with `by = join_by(country_name)`


# A tibble: 5 × 5
  country_name ladder_score   gdp social_support healthy_life_expectancy
  <chr>               <dbl> <dbl>          <dbl>                   <dbl>
1 Iraq                 4.85  9.24          0.746                    60.6
2 Comoros              4.29  8.03          0.626                    57.3
3 Panama               6.18 10.4           0.896                    69.7
4 Maldives             5.20  9.83          0.913                    70.6
5 Spain                6.49 10.6           0.932                    74.7

title: Combining Data Sets
text:
Problem Five
Filter out all countries from happy_full that are also in happy

happy_full %>%
  anti_join(happy)

Joining with `by = join_by(country_name, ladder_score, social_support)`

title: Claire J. Grenis
text:
Alt text


Student-Athlete studying Environmental Science, Earth Systems Science: Geography while playing field hockey at the Division I level.
Click on the links below to learn more.

To learn more about Earth Systems Science at Appalachian State University.
To learn more about Appalachian State Field Hockey.

title: Example Geographical Information Systems Map
text:
The use of GIS and my ability to use software such as ArcGIS Pro has proven to be extremely useful throughout my academic career thus far.
The following map was completed through the use of a shapefile containing the required data and ArcGIS Pro.



Alt text

title: Involvement and Awards
text:
All of the following are projects that I have either been involved in as a research intern or as a member of the participating team. Awards I have received are also included.

In the summer of 2024, I worked as a research intern at Syracuse University to analyze thawed permafrost samples for dissolved organic carbon, total nitrogen, pH, and other values. Dissolved Organic Carbon in Northern Permafrost Information
In the opening weekend of the 2024 field hockey season posted back-to-back shutouts to earn MAC Defensive Player of the Week. Mid-American Conference Defensive Player of the Week
Was a member of the 2023 Appalachian State Field Hockey team that won the first championship title in program history. 2023 MAC Championship Team Roster
Serve as an intern for the Appalachian Geological and Environmental Sciences Department’s DAGGER team. Devonian Anoxia, Geochemistry, Geochronology, and Extinction Research Team
Am able to exhibit the skills necessary to combine data sets within RStudio in the STT2860 course at Appalachian State University. Combining Data Sets
